quickRecipes.title: Quick Garlic Pasta (Aglio e Olio)
quickRecipes.description: A classic Italian pasta dish that's ready in under 15 minutes with just a few ingredients.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook pasta according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-low heat.
Add sliced garlic and red pepper flakes, cook for 2-3 minutes until garlic is golden and fragrant.
Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain the pasta.
Add pasta to the skillet with garlic oil and toss to combine.
Add pasta water gradually until you achieve a silky sauce consistency.
Remove from heat, add parsley and Parmesan cheese, toss well.
Season with salt and pepper, serve immediately with extra cheese.
tips: Don't let the garlic burn - it should be golden, not brown
Save some pasta water - the starch helps create a creamy sauce
Serve immediately for the best texture

quickRecipes.title: Lightning Fast Chicken Stir Fry
quickRecipes.description: A colorful and nutritious stir fry that's packed with vegetables and ready in 20 minutes.
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
instructions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add chicken pieces and cook for 4-5 minutes until golden and cooked through.
Remove chicken and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the same pan, add garlic and ginger, stir for 30 seconds.
Add bell pepper, broccoli, and carrot. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until crisp-tender.
Return chicken to the pan.
Mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil in a small bowl.
Pour sauce over the stir-fry and toss everything together for 1-2 minutes.
Garnish with green onions and serve over rice.
tips: Cut all ingredients before you start cooking - stir frying is fast!
Keep the heat high for that perfect 'wok hei' flavor
Don't overcrowd the pan or vegetables will steam instead of stir-fry

quickRecipes.title: Gourmet Caprese Grilled Cheese
quickRecipes.description: Elevate your grilled cheese game with fresh mozzarella, tomatoes, and basil.
instructions: Butter one side of each bread slice.
On the unbuttered side, layer mozzarella, tomato slices, and basil leaves.
Season tomatoes with salt and pepper.
Top with remaining bread slices, buttered side facing out.
Heat a skillet over medium heat.
Cook sandwiches for 3-4 minutes per side until golden and cheese is melted.
Remove from heat and let cool for 1 minute.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.
Cut diagonally and serve warm.
tips: Use day-old bread for better structure
Pat tomatoes dry to prevent soggy bread
Cook on medium heat to ensure cheese melts before bread burns

quickRecipes.title: Buttery Shrimp Scampi
quickRecipes.description: Restaurant-quality shrimp scampi that's surprisingly easy to make at home.
ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Cook linguine according to package directions, reserve 1/2 cup pasta water.
Season shrimp with salt and pepper.
Heat 2 tablespoons butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add shrimp and cook for 1-2 minutes per side until pink. Remove and set aside.
Add garlic to the same pan and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add white wine and lemon juice, simmer for 2 minutes.
Stir in remaining butter and red pepper flakes.
Return shrimp to pan and add cooked pasta.
Toss with pasta water to create a silky sauce.
Garnish with parsley and serve with Parmesan.
tips: Don't overcook shrimp - they cook very quickly
Use real Parmesan cheese for the best flavor
Pasta water helps bind the sauce together

quickRecipes.title: Mediterranean Veggie Quesadilla
quickRecipes.description: A fusion twist on quesadillas with Mediterranean flavors and vegetables.
instructions: Brush one side of each tortilla with olive oil.
On the unbuttered side of 2 tortillas, layer feta, sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, olives, and red onion.
Sprinkle with oregano and top with remaining tortillas (oiled side up).
Heat a large skillet over medium heat.
Cook quesadillas one at a time, 3-4 minutes per side until golden and crispy.
Remove from heat and let cool for 2 minutes.
Cut into wedges and serve with tzatziki sauce.
Garnish with fresh herbs if desired.
tips: Don't overfill or ingredients will spill out
Press gently with spatula while cooking for even browning
Let cool slightly before cutting to prevent filling from falling out

quickRecipes.title: Honey Teriyaki Salmon
quickRecipes.description: Flaky salmon glazed with a sweet and savory teriyaki sauce, ready in 20 minutes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a small saucepan, whisk together soy sauce, honey, rice vinegar, garlic, and ginger.
Bring to a simmer over medium heat.
Mix cornstarch and water, add to the sauce and cook until thickened, about 2 minutes.
Place salmon fillets on a lined baking sheet.
Brush salmon with half of the teriyaki glaze.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until salmon flakes easily.
Brush with remaining glaze during the last 5 minutes of cooking.
Garnish with green onions and sesame seeds before serving.
tips: Don't overcook salmon - it should be slightly translucent in the center
Let the glaze thicken properly for better coating
Serve with steamed rice and vegetables

exampleImages.tip: Natural light or bright kitchen lighting gives the best results
